dialogue.text: Kade, this is Owl. I've managed to patch into all three channels simultaneously. They're all demanding different things from you on this floor.
The Agency wants Glady's badge recovered from the security desk - could be crucial for accessing restricted areas.
The Corporation is pushing for HR server logs - probably looking for blackmail material or recruitment targets.
Government spooks want all visitor logs destroyed - classic cover-up operation.
Problem is, you can't do all three without raising alarms. Choose carefully - each faction will reward you differently, but they'll also notice if you ignore their priorities.
Understood, Owl. Glady's badge is my priority. If I can grab the server logs on the way, I will. But I'm not burning evidence until I know what we're dealing with.
Smart move. The badge should be near the north security desk. Watch for patrols - they've doubled guard rotation since Glady's breach.
Security floor, Kade. Heavy surveillance here. All three factions have different approaches.
Agency wants you to create blind spots in the camera coverage - would help your movement but might draw attention.
Corporation is demanding a backdoor in their systems - risky but could give us long-term access.
Government wants you to confiscate access cards - brute force approach that might lock down the facility.
Glady's last transmission mentioned she had to bypass this floor quickly - said the security AI was 'unusually adaptive'. Watch your back.
Adaptive AI? That explains the strange patrol patterns. I'll create camera blind spots first - need to move freely before attempting any hacks.
Good call. The control room is to your east. I'm detecting two guards on regular patrol, but that AI might change their patterns without warning.
Research level, Kade. This is where Glady's last confirmed signal originated. All factions are extremely interested in what's down here.
Agency wants prototype schematics - probably related to whatever Glady discovered.
Corporation wants you to plant false research data - sabotage operation.
Government wants chemical samples confiscated - containment protocol.
If Glady is still alive, she's likely hiding in this sector. Look for her markers - she always leaves a small owl doodle as a trail.
I see one of her marks near the ventilation shaft. She was here. Whatever she found must be big if all three factions want pieces of it.
Focus, Kade. Get what you need but prioritize finding Glady. The schematics might reveal what they're really developing here.
Understood. I'll grab the schematics and look for Glady. The government can have their samples if it means containing this mess.
Armory level, Kade. Heavily fortified. Choose your approach carefully.
Agency wants weapon blueprints - could give us an edge if things go hot.
Corporation wants ammo sabotage - risky but would cripple their security forces.
Government wants prototype weapons secured - deniable assets for their black ops.
Glady's tracker briefly pinged near here before going silent again. She might have been looking for something to defend herself.
I need those blueprints. If Glady's in trouble, knowing their weapons could save us both. The prototypes can wait.
Blueprints are in the western archive. Thermal shows three guards stationed there. You'll need to draw them out or take them quietly.
Executive floor, Kade. Where the decisions get made. All factions want leverage here.
Agency wants meeting transcripts - could expose the truth about this facility.
Corporation wants blackmail material - standard corporate espionage.
Government wants executives arrested - silencing loose ends.
I'm detecting encrypted communications that match Glady's encryption pattern. She might be monitoring these suites.
The transcripts could reveal what happened to Glady. I'm going for those first. If I can grab compromising data on the way, even better.
Boardroom is your target. They're having a meeting in 10 minutes - perfect time to plant listening devices while it's empty.
Data center, Kade. The brain of the operation. All factions want control of the information here.
Agency wants comms interception - real-time intelligence on their operations.
Corporation wants spyware installation - long-term surveillance access.
Government wants servers shutdown - complete data denial.
I'm picking up fragments of Glady's data signature in the network traffic. She's been in these systems recently.
If Glady's data is in there, I need to intercept those communications before the government destroys everything.
Prioritize the comms hub in sector 4-B. I'll try to isolate her data signature so we can pinpoint her location.
Penthouse level, Kade. The inner sanctum. Factions have their endgame plays ready.
Agency wants a double agent eliminated - high risk, high reward.
Corporation wants a politician bribed - influence game.
Government wants a dignitary protected - maintaining appearances.
Glady's signal is strong here. She's somewhere on this floor, but I can't pinpoint exactly where with all the interference.
I'm not playing their games, Owl. I'm here for Glady. If that double agent gets in my way, that's their problem.
Careful, Kade. The double agent likely knows about Glady's location. They might be using her as bait. Proceed with extreme caution.
Rooftop extraction, Kade. This is where it ends - one way or another. All factions are preparing their exfil plans.
Agency has a chopper inbound if you can secure the LZ and protect whatever intel you've recovered.
Corporation wants you to hijack enemy extraction - risky but high reward if you pull it off.
Government wants full military lockdown - complete deniability operation.
Whatever you choose, make it count. I'll be in your ear until the end. Find Glady, get out alive, and remember - trust no one but yourself.
I've got Glady. She's injured but stable. We're taking the Agency extraction. If the Corporation or Government get in our way, they'll regret it.
Agency chopper is 2 minutes out. I've scrambled their air support to create a diversion. Get to the LZ and watch for snipers on the western tower.
Almost there, Owl. Thanks for having my back through this hell.
Always, Kade. Now bring her home.
